channel.title: I am Amit, I make things. on Amit Gaur
channel.description: Recent content in I am Amit, I make things. on Amit Gaur

item.title: Paraphrasing Tool
item.description: In this I discuss the building blocks for the paraphrasing tool.

item.title: How to fix Postgres sequences
item.description: In this I go over how to fix postgres sequences.

item.title: How to use Digital Ocean Spaces for Arc Ecto file uploads
item.description: In this I explain how to use Digital Ocean spaces instead of Amazon S3 for uploading files using Arc Ecto

item.title: How to Refresh Tokens in Cognito using Amplify JS
item.description: In this I explain how to refresh idToken and accessToken in Cognito using Amplify JS

item.title: How to inject props into dynamically rendered components via slot in stenciljs
item.description: In this I explain how to pass props to components that are rendered dynamically in stencil js using Slot tag.

item.title: How to get remote ip from x-forwarded-for header in Phoenix
item.description: In this I explain how to get correct remote ip in phoenix framework from x-forwarded-for. When the server is being proxied through something like nginx.

item.title: Technical interviews : Take home projects
item.description: In this, I discuss take home assignments or projects for technical hiring.

item.title: How to use UUIDs as Primary Key with ecto
item.description: In this, I explain how to use UUIDs as primary key instead of IDs when using ecto with Phoenix Framework.

item.title: Fixing utf8 encoding issue in Postgres
item.description: In this post, I setup Postgres for rails on an Ubuntu machine. And fix utf8 encoding issue.

item.title: About
item.description: Hello, I am Amit Gaur, thanks for visting my site. I am a polyglot programmer, with a keen eye for design. My interest lies in creating products that are functional and have good design aesthetics. This site is a log of my journey as I try and learn new things.

item.title: Contact
item.description: This is an open invitation: if you want to talk software, products or technology, I want to talk to you. My email address is amitgaur.web[at]gmail.com I have websymphony as handle on most social networks. I prefer email, but if you want to just holler on twitter, that is cool too. I love talking about software, applications, technologies. If you are a startup, engineer, student, or a person interested in any of these and need someone to hash out ideas with.
